news_header: Over 200,000 people have fled Sudan recently due to ongoing conflict, with over 14 million displaced overall.
news_text: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) reports that approximately 200,000 people have fled Sudan since last month, contributing to a total of over 14 million displaced individuals, both internally and externally, due to the ongoing civil war that began in April 2023. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has characterized the humanitarian crisis in Sudan as dire, highlighting the worsening conditions of hunger, disease, and ethnic violence affecting the population.
